thread.title: This Year More People Have Been Killed By Selfies Than Sharks
thread.title_full: This Year More People Have Been Killed By Selfies Than Sharks

author: Eve Hartley
title: This Year More People Have Been Killed By Selfies Than Sharks
text:
This Year More People Have Been Killed By Selfies Than Sharks Huffington Post UK 1 day ago Eve Hartley The latest selfie fatality saw a 66-year-old Japanese tourist die after after falling down stairs while attempting to take a photo at the Taj Mahal.
Incidents involving the phenomena are now at a toll of twelve this year, overtaking the eight deaths caused by shark attacks in 2015.
Some governments are recognising this danger and providing safety measures for people partaking in the craze.
Selfies are more dangerous than sharks
Earlier this year the Russian government launched a campaign to make people understand the perils of snapping selfies in dangerous situations.
Â© abadonian via Getty Images A snorkeller doubles his chance of death. An illustrated booklet was issued by the advisors, warning its citizens of dangerous scenarios, including snapping a photo while halfway up an electricity pylon, standing in front of an oncoming train, or while in the company of a wild animal.
According to the ministry , Police officers will also hold extensive selfie-safety lessons at schools.
Official Yelena Alekseyeva made a statement when the leaflet was released and said: "Our booklet reminds you of how to take a safe selfie, so it is not the last one you will ever take."
SEE ALSO: This Instagram Filter Will Get You The Most Likes
Teenage Father Of Two Accidentally Kills Himself Taking Selfie With Gun
Pre-Med Student Takes Smiling Selfie Next To Dying Patient This rise in selfie related deaths is highlighted by horrendous incidents involving the photography technique.
In September a father-of-two accidentally killed himself when taking a selfie with a loaded gun - and last month, a man in Spain was gored to death by a bull while taking a selfie at the annual bull running festival in the town of Villaseca de la Sagra.
